snippet: The group As You Sow said nanoparticles, the size of molecules, have been found in the blood stream after ingestion and inhalation.
abstract: New report from nonprofit group As You Sow shows that nanomaterials, substances broken down by technology into molecule-size particles, are starting to enter the food chain through well-known food products and their packaging, but there is little acknowledgement by the companies using them.
lead_paragraph: The group As You Sow said nanoparticles, the size of molecules, have been found in the blood stream after ingestion and inhalation.

headline.seo: Nanoparticles in Food Raise Concern by Advocacy Group
headline.main: Study Looks at Particles Used in Food
headline.print_headline: Study Looks At Particles Used in Food
